did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.physdesc: This collection consists of eighty-six photographs.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Photographs of Shenandoah Valley Families, Accession #14286, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These photographs were purchased from Crown Collectibles, Chesterfield, Virginia, on August 19, 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of eighty-six photographs, ca. 1880s-1930s, of relatives and friends of the Dr. J.T. Glick family and the Cline family. The only dated photograph is of an infant, Jeraldine Koontz, 1928. Over half of the subjects are unidentified. Several may be of divinity students and graduates at [Eastern Mennonite College, Harrisonburg?] including the Rev. David Hoover, the Rev. A. B. Miller, the Rev. Minor Myers, the Rev. Howard Alley, and the Rev. Lun Wine. Other identified portraits include Dr. W. T. Sanger of Harrisonburg; the Reverend Wilbur Stover, pioneer Church of the Brethren missionary to India. The collection contains photographs from studios in Bridgewater, Harrisonburg, Roanoke, Staunton, especially Dean's Studio, Harrisonburg.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The photographs are grouped by studio and subarranged by whether or not the subjects are identified.

did.unittitle: Harrisonburg: Dean's Studio: Identified A-D n.d.

scopecontent.p: Howard Alley, Bessie Arnold, Anna Bowman, Effie Bowman (2 items), Flora Hoover Bowman, May Craun Cline (Uncle Frank's sister), Maggie Evers Clower, Aubrey Coffman, Anna Driver of Timberville.

did.unittitle: Harrisonburg: Dean's Studio: Identified H-L 1928, n.d.

scopecontent.p: Lila Harvey (student of J.T. Glick), David Hoover, Ollie Kerlin (3 items), Jeraldine Koontz, Lena Leatherman (2 items)

did.unittitle: Harrisonburg: Dean's Studio: Identified M-W n.d.

scopecontent.p: Ella Miller (2 items), Lottie Miller, Minor C. Miller (son of Samuel Miller), Omega L. Miller, Minor Myers, Dr. W.T. Sanger, Anna Bowman Seese, Norman Seese, Lun Wine, Attie Cline Wine, Celesta [Thelma] Wine, Lucretia Wise.

did.unittitle: Staunton, Bridgewater, Roanoke, etc.: Identified n.d.

scopecontent.p: Ben Craun, Hiram Craun, Aunt Mary Farrar, Annie Gordon (age 81), William Shickel Krantz, Esther Leidik, Virgie McAvoy (student at B.C.), Rev. A.B. Miller and wife, Dan Shickel, Dan Shickel's oldest boy, Will Shickel, Wilber Stover, 1st Church of the Brethren Missionary to India, Roscoe Wheeler, Lun Wine.

did.unittitle: Staunton, Bridgewater, Roanoke, etc.: Unidentified n.d.
